mob.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a large noisy crowd, especially one that is angry and violent
mob.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: They were immediately surrounded by the mob.
The leadership had been criticized for giving in to mob rule  (=when a mob controls the situation rather than the government or the law).
a mob of a few hundred demonstrators
mob.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a group of people of the same type
mob.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: What happens if they send the heavy mob round to find him?
The usual mob of teenagers were standing on the corner.
mob.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: if people mob a famous person, they rush to get close to them and form a crowd around them
mob.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Fans ran onto the pitch and mobbed the batsman.
mob.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: if a group of birds or animals mob another bird or animal, they all attack it
